intro: Cacalia cylindrica, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are typically blue or violet in color and bloom in late summer. The plant prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas.
